Enter The Value You Want To Convert.

Quick tips on using DigiCalc

DigiCalc will calculate 64bit binary, octal and hexadecimal values.

Navigate by tapping on the desired tab or swipe in the proper direction.

Select your desired operation, \"Add\", \"Mult\", or \"Div\" from the drop down menu.

Subtraction is done in the \"Add\" mode, by placing a negative sign in front of the desired value. See directly below.

The negative sign key is a toggle. The negative sign key on the keypad is designed so that when you tap on it once it will place a negative sign on the far left end of the value. Tapping on it again will remove it. Regardless of the cursor\'s position in the value.

To correct a typo, tap on the value at the desired position then, if needed, use the arrow keys, \"<\" or \">\", to position the cursor to just behind the digit to be changed, then tap \"Del\" key to delete that digit, then tap on the correct value.

Testing was performed using two unique sources for solutions which were compared against the calculation algorithm\'s output. Even though numerous hours were spent testing, there is bound to be a pair of values that will produce erroneous results. We would be VERY interested in having the pair of values to troubleshoot and test with. Please send the pair of values, which base, arithmetic mode, and the results you\'re getting to: woodlandcoders@gmail.com. For quick identification the subject should read: \"Bad DigiCalc Results\".
